title: myechow
text:
Manuscript Overview
Title: Predicting Adolescentsâ€™ Future Smoking Behavior through Anti-Smoking Ad Exposure
Methodology: Structural Equation Modeling (SEM) grounded in the Theory of Planned Behavior
Dataset: Monitoring the Future (MTF) 2023 Survey
Sample: ~14,000 U.S. adolescents (Grades 8 & 10)
Key Findings:

âœ… Anti-smoking ads impact beliefs via attitudes, norms, and behavior control
âœ… Strong internal consistency across TPB constructs (AVE > 0.5, CR > 0.89)
âœ… SEM results show PBC is the strongest predictor of smoking intention




Structural Equation Modeling

ATT â€“ Attitude toward smoking

INJ â€“ Injunctive norm

DES â€“ Desire to smoke

PBC â€“ Perceived behavioral control

title: Biostatistics Masterâ€™s Thesis by Myesha C Iqbal
text:
SEM Constructs
The following psycho-cognitive variables were modeled using SEM:



Construct
Description




ATT
Attitude toward smoking


INJ
Injunctive Norms


DES
Descriotive Norms


PBC
Perceived Behavioral Control


INT
Intention for Future Smoking


SMK
Current Smoking Status


ADS
Anti-Smoking Advertisement Exposure

title: Biostatistics Masterâ€™s Thesis by Myesha C Iqbal
Biostatistics Masterâ€™s Thesis by Myesha C Iqbal
text:
Key Findings

Anti-smoking ads significantly influence adolescent beliefs through attitudes, norms, and perceived behavioral control
High internal consistency across TPB constructs (AVE > 0.50, CR > 0.89)
PBC emerged as the strongest predictor of intention to smoke
